message.text: Actions job or workflow does not limit the permissions of the GITHUB_TOKEN. Consider setting an explicit permissions block, using the following as a minimal starting point: {{contents: read}}

repository.description: The repository from which the slash command was dispatched

comment-id.description: The comment-id of the slash command

actor.description: The user who executed the slash command

steps.name: Create URL to the run output

with.body:
> [Command run output](${{ steps.vars.outputs.run-url }})
> Build command workflow started.
> Installing dependencies
> Running script `./build.sh`

steps.name: Check if changes were made
steps.run:
git diff --quiet && git diff --staged --quiet
HAS_CHANGES=$?
echo "has-changes=$HAS_CHANGES" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
echo "$HAS_CHANGES"

steps.name: Commit changes to the PR branch
steps.run:
git config --global user.name 'github-actions[bot]'
git config --global user.email '41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com'
git diff --quiet && git diff --staged --quiet || (git commit -am "[build-command] Update generated files")
git push

with.body: > Build command workflow completed updating files.

steps.name: Create final comment no updated files

with.body: > Build command workflow completed without updating files.
